title: Automation on the Fly
tags: active-directory, automation, windows-server, windows
snippet: Recently, I stumbled on an initiative “The Auror Project” by Sudarshan Pisupati which was starting a course called “3 Machine Labs”.“3 Machine Labs” is a challenge based learning approach to solidify fundamentals of Active Directory over a series of 9 sessions.The first session came with a challe...

title: Vault
tags: linux, cewl, host-header-injection, upload-bypass, pivoting, ssh-remote-forwarding, netcat-port-scan, bash-history, auth-log, rbash, gpg, add-ip, remove-route, hackthebox
snippet: Vault is medium to hard difficulty machine, which requires bypassing host and file upload restrictions, tunneling, creating malicious OpenVPN configuration files and PGP decryption.ReconnaissanceMasscan + Nmap$ masscan -p1-65535,U:1-65535 `IP` --rate=5000 -e tun0 | tee masscan.outParse those port...

title: Knife
tags: linux, zerodium, knife, hackthebox
snippet: Knife is an easy difficulty Linux machine that features an application which is running on a backdoored version of PHP: PHP/8.1.0-dev. This vulnerability is leveraged to obtain the foothold on the server. A sudo misconfiguration is then exploited to gain a root shell.Nmap$ nmap -sVC -v --min-rate...

title: Ypuffy
tags: openbsd, ldap, ssh-ca-auth, certificate, doas, xorg, hackthebox
snippet: Ypuffy is medium difficulty machine which highlights the danger of allowing LDAP null sessions. It also features an interesting SSH CA authentication privilege escalation, via the OpenBSD doas command. An additional privilege escalation involving Xorg is also possible.Masscan + Nmap$ masscan -p1-...

title: Giddy
tags: windows, sql-injection, ms-sql, xp_dirtree, ntlmv2, responder, dll-hijacking, service-exploit, ubiquiti-unfi-video, bypass-av, bypass-applock, bypass-clm, hackthebox
snippet: Giddy is a super cool box which gives real-life experience by Bypassing Windows Defender, Applock and Constrained Language Mode.It starts with enumeration leading to a site which is vulnerable to SQL injection on MS-SQL. I’ll abuse SQL-Injection to make giddy a SMB connect to me, through xp_dirtr...

title: Love
tags: windows, ssrf, lfi, image-upload, alwaysinstallelevated, hackthebox
snippet: Love is an easy box, Awesome for beginners. Starts with a SSRF to access a forbidden page meant to be accessed locally which leaks credentials for a Voting system. That voting system allows anyone to upload images. By exploiting upload functionality, I achieve RCE. Finally, I get system by abusin...

title: TartarSauce
tags: linux, wordpress-plugin, rfi, tar, mysql, cronjob, symlink, race-condition, hackthebox
snippet: Foothold starts with Wordpress plugin gwolle-gb which is vulnerable to Remote File-Inclusion. You can get user by exploiting sudo privileges on tar, then grabbing MySQL DB password from web-root and dumping database. There’s a cronjob running as root, which creates gzip files using tar. Exploitin...

title: Olympus
tags: linux, ctf, x-debug, aircrack-ng, zone-transfer, port-knock, docker, hackthebox
snippet: Olympus is CTF-like box. Starting with exploting X-Debug plugin in Apache with just HTTP Headers which gives you a container shell. You pivot to other containers while exploring techniques like 802.11 Wi-Fi cracking, DNS Zone Transfer, Port Knocking which lands you to the actual host. Then you’ve...

title: Stratosphere
tags: linux, tomcat, mysql, python-library-hijack, python-input-injection, hackthebox
snippet: Stratosphere is a pretty cool box with an Apache Struts vulnerability in which endpoints ending with .action, .go, .do can be injected with a specially crafted Content-Header leading to Remote code execution. The exploit doesn’t give us a shell, So I went on with Dumping MySQL database without an...
